full_text: The Red Sox got better, all around as an organization. If you can‚Äôt see it, I can‚Äôt explain it.

The Red Sox are better than they were last week. They upgraded 1B/OF w/o giving up much & added prospect depth for a downgrade at C. Now they are banking on the IL guys returning & will push for the playoffs. Still big decisions to come, they've just been punted to the offseason.

So, the Red Sox didn't exactly sell. They didn't go all in on buying, either. But they needed a first baseman and an outfielder and got both. No additions are going to make huge headlines, but they are technically a better MLB team and have a stronger farm system? There's that.
If you‚Äôre a Sox fan I think you should be happy with the moves Bloom made. Improved first base, added another outfielder, and got some solid prospects.
Eric Hosmer will play for the Red Sox while the Padres cover his FULL salary, opens the door for the Red Sox to move him this offseason if they want to go that way.
